1.text: These have I spoken, that ye should not be offended.

2.text: They shall make you excluded from the synagogue: but the hour comes that every one having slain you should think to bring service to God.

3.text: And these things shall they do to you, for they know not the Father, nor me.

4.text: But these have I spoken to you, that when the hour should come, ye should remember them, for I said to you. And these I said not to you from the beginning, for I was with you.

5.text: But now do I retire to him having sent me; and not one of you asks me, Where dost thou retire.

6.text: But because I have spoken these to you, sorrow has filled your heart.

7.text: But I say the truth to you; it is profitable to you that I go away: for if I go not away, the Intercessor shall not come to you; and if I go, I will send him to you.

8.text: And having come, he will convict the world of sin, and of justice, and of judgment:

9.text: Truly of sin, because they believe not in me;

10.text: And of justice, because I retire to my Father, and ye see me no more;

11.text: And of judgment, for the ruler of this world has been judged.

12.text: I have yet many things to say to you, but ye cannot bear them now.

13.text: And when he should come, the Spirit of truth, he shall guide you into all truth: for he shall not speak of himself; but whatever he should hear, shall he speak: and he shall announce to you the things coming.

14.text: He shall honour me: for he shall take of mine, and announce to you.

15.text: All things which the Father has are mine: therefore said I, he shall take of mine, and announce to you.

16.text: A little while, and ye see me not: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me, and because I retire to the Father.

17.text: Then said of his disciples to one another, What is this which he says to you, A little, and ye see me not: and again, a little, and ye shall see me: and, Because I retire to my Father?

18.text: Then said they, What is this which he says, A little we know not what he says.

19.text: Then knew Jesus that they wished to ask him, and he said to them, For this seek ye with one another that I said, A little while, and ye see me not; and again a little, and ye shall see me.

20.text: Truly, truly, I say to you, That ye shall weep and lament, but the world shall rejoice: and ye shall be grieved, but your grief shall be into joy.

21.text: A woman when she should bring forth, has grief, because her hour has come: and when the child should be born, she no more remembers the anguish, for the joy that a man was born into the world.

22.text: And where truly ye now have sorrow: but I will see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no one takes away from you.

23.text: And in that day ye shall ask me nothing. Truly, truly, I say to you, That whatever ye shall ask the Father in my name, he will give you.

24.text: Until now ye have asked nothing in my name: ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy might be completed.

25.text: These have I spoken to you in proverbs: but the hour comes, when I shall no more speak to you in proverbs, but with freedom of speech will I announce to you of the Father.

26.text: In that day shall ye ask in my name: and I say not to you that I will ask the Father for you:

27.text: For the Father himself loves you, for ye have loved me, and believed that I came forth from God.

28.text: I came forth from the Father, and have come into the world: again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.

29.text: His disciples say to him, See, now thou speakest with freedom of speech, and sayest no proverb.

30.text: Now we know that thou knowest all things, and hast no need that any ask thee: by this we believe that thou earnest forth from God.

31.text: Jesus answered them, Now do ye believe?

32.text: Behold, the hour comes, and has now come, that ye be scattered, each to his own, and leave me alone: and I am not alone, for the Father is with me.

33.text: These have I spoken to you, that in me ye might have peace. In the world shall ye have pressure; but take courage; I have conquered the world.
